meanings.definition: relating to or resembling a calyx
meanings.sent1: The calyceal shape of the flower petals was truly beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied the calyceal structures of various plants in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The calyceal design of the vase made it look like a delicate cupcake wrapper.
meanings.sent4: Her dress cascaded around her in a calyceal fashion, flowing like flower petals.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted the calyceal patterns with vibrant colors, bringing the artwork to life.

meanings.definition: of or relating to a calyx or calyces
meanings.sent1: The calyceal cover protected the delicate flower bud from harsh weather.
meanings.sent2: The calyceal structure of the plant provided support for the blooming flowers.
meanings.sent3: The calyceal shield acted like a superhero cape for the tiny bud.
meanings.sent4: The calyceal embrace of the petals kept the flower safe and warm.
meanings.sent5: The calyceal layer around the fruit kept it fresh and juicy for longer.

meanings.definition: pertaining to or resembling a calyx
meanings.sent1: The calyceal appearance of the seashell reminded her of a delicate flower.
meanings.sent2: The calyceal structure of the plant helped in seed dispersal.
meanings.sent3: The calyceal shape of the umbrella made it look like a blooming flower.
meanings.sent4: The calyceal protection shielded the seeds from harsh environmental conditions.
meanings.sent5: The calyceal design of the building's roof added a touch of elegance to the architecture.
